item.title: Hello World Three
item.description: Custom image Acknowledgements References Reproducibility ## This imaged will be saved in the /post/*_files/ directory Use echo = FALSE if ## you want to hide the code for making the plot plot(1:10, 10:1) Custom image The easiest option is to use the Insert Image RStudio addin to add an external image. item.title: Hello World Two
item.description: R image Custom image Acknowledgements References Reproducibility Did this work? And what about this? Typical location to start editing since the bibliography chunk is hidden. Make sure that you selected R Markdown (.Rmd) as the format option of the post when using the New Post addin. R image ## This imaged will be saved in the /post/*_files/ directory Use echo = FALSE if ## you want to hide the code for making the plot plot(1:10, 10:1) Custom image The easiest option is to use the Insert Image RStudio addin to add an external image.

item.title: Hello World One

Post content Typical location to start editing since the bibliography chunk is hidden. Make sure that you selected R Markdown (.Rmd) as the format option of the post when using the New Post addin. R image ## This imaged will be saved in the /post/*_files/ directory ## Use echo = FALSE if you want to hide the code for making the plot plot(1:10, 10:1) Custom image The easiest option is to use the Insert Image RStudio addin to add an external image.

item.title: Insert HTML Widgets in Blogdown
item.description: Load Libraries Insert Data Tables or DT Widget Insert Leaflet Widget Insert Sigma JS Insert Plotly Widget There were two main reasons for moving to blogdown. First, I needed a blogging platform that moved seemlessly between R code and its output. It had to be easy to show the connection between the code that was used and its effect on the data.
